üöÄ Implement comprehensive agent task management system

This represents a complete implementation of an intelligent, emoji-enhanced task management system designed for agent-based workflows with advanced automation and analytics capabilities.

## üéØ Core Implementation Features

**Task Management Infrastructure:**
- Comprehensive task lifecycle management with status transitions
- Emoji-enhanced directory structure (üì¶ backlog ‚Üí üìã todo ‚Üí üîÑ in-progress ‚Üí ‚úÖ done)
- Advanced dependency resolution and circular dependency detection
- Intelligent auto-fix system for validation issues
- Multi-agent coordination with workload balancing

**Enhanced Logging & Monitoring:**
- Emoji-enhanced logging system for improved UX and accessibility
- Persistent disk logging with rotation and structured formats
- Comprehensive audit trails and performance monitoring
- Three-tier logging (debug, standard, error) with configurable levels

**Intelligent CLI Interface:**
- Rich command-line interface with color-coded output and emoji indicators
- Smart filtering with completed tasks hidden by default
- Comprehensive analytics and reporting capabilities
- Template system for standardized task creation
- Auto-transition system for dependency-based workflow automation

**Validation & Quality Assurance:**
- Robust validation system with configurable rules and limits
- Agent assignment validation with automatic migration suggestions
- Date validation, dependency verification, and business rule enforcement
- Comprehensive system-wide consistency checks

**Advanced Analytics:**
- Agent performance metrics and workload analysis
- Velocity trends and completion rate tracking
- Bottleneck identification and dependency analysis
- Critical path detection and risk assessment

## üìä Technical Metrics
- **109 files**: Complete system implementation
- **13,162+ lines**: Comprehensive feature set
- **8 core modules**: Modular, maintainable architecture
- **80+ task templates**: Covering diverse workflow needs
- **6 status categories**: Complete workflow coverage

## üé® User Experience Enhancements
- Intuitive emoji-based visual organization
- Smart defaults reducing cognitive load
- Rich formatting and contextual feedback
- Comprehensive documentation and examples

This system demonstrates production-ready task management with enterprise-level features including intelligent automation, comprehensive monitoring, and sophisticated analytics‚Äîall wrapped in an intuitive, emoji-enhanced interface designed for maximum productivity and minimum cognitive overhead.

# Advanced Error Handling Implementation

## Goals
- Production-grade error handling with graceful degradation
- Zero unhandled errors during professional demonstrations  
- Comprehensive fallback systems for all critical features
- Professional error messaging and recovery patterns

## Implementation Areas
1. Global error handlers for JavaScript exceptions
2. Network failure resilience with retry mechanisms
3. Resource loading fallbacks for external dependencies
4. User interaction error boundaries with recovery
5. Browser compatibility error handling

## Success Metrics
- 100% error catch rate with professional recovery
- Sub-100ms error recovery time
- Graceful degradation maintaining 95%+ functionality
- Zero visible errors during stakeholder demonstrations

Critical for maintaining professional credibility during executive reviews.

recent_issues.title: ‚ö° Performance Optimization - Sub-2-second Load Times for Stakeholder Impressions
recent_issues.body:
# üöÄ Quick Win: Performance Optimization

## üéØ **Performance Goals**
- **Load Time**: < 2 seconds for stakeholder impressions  
- **Lighthouse Score**: 90+ across all categories
- **First Contentful Paint**: < 1.5 seconds
- **Cumulative Layout Shift**: < 0.1

## üìä **Current Performance Analysis**

### **Critical Performance Factors**
1. **Font Loading**: Google Fonts (Inter + JetBrains Mono)
2. **CSS Bundle Size**: Large stylesheet needs optimization
3. **JavaScript Execution**: Interactive features and animations
4. **Image Optimization**: Profile images and assets
5. **Resource Loading**: Preloading and critical resource prioritization

### **Professional Impact**
- **Executive Attention Span**: 3-second rule for professional websites
- **First Impressions**: Performance directly affects perceived competence
- **Mobile Networks**: 3G/4G performance critical for mobile professionals
- **International Access**: CDN and global performance considerations

## üîß **Immediate Optimizations Required**

### **Phase 1: Critical Resource Optimization**
1. **Font Loading Strategy**
   - Implement font-display: swap for faster rendering
   - Preload critical fonts
   - Consider font subsetting for faster downloads

2. **CSS Optimization**
   - Critical CSS inlining for above-the-fold content
   - Defer non-critical CSS
   - Remove unused CSS rules
   - Minify CSS in production

3. **JavaScript Performance**
   - Defer non-critical JavaScript
   - Optimize animation performance
   - Implement efficient event handling
   - Bundle optimization and tree shaking

### **Phase 2: Advanced Performance**
1. **Resource Preloading**
   - Preload critical resources
   - Implement resource hints (dns-prefetch, preconnect)
   - Optimize loading sequence

2. **Caching Strategy**
   - Browser caching optimization
   - Service worker for offline performance
   - CDN integration for global performance

3. **Image Optimization**
   - WebP format support with fallbacks
   - Responsive images for different screen sizes
   - Lazy loading for non-critical images

## üìà **Performance Metrics Tracking**

### **Core Web Vitals**
- **Largest Contentful Paint (LCP)**: < 2.5s
- **First Input Delay (FID)**: < 100ms  
- **Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS)**: < 0.1

### **Additional Performance KPIs**
- **Time to First Byte (TTFB)**: < 200ms
- **First Contentful Paint (FCP)**: < 1.5s
- **Speed Index**: < 2.0s
- **Total Blocking Time (TBT)**: < 300ms

## üõ†Ô∏è **Implementation Plan**

### **Immediate Fixes (Today)**
1. Add font-display: swap to font loading
2. Implement preconnect for external resources
3. Optimize CSS delivery strategy
4. Add resource hints for performance

### **Advanced Optimizations (This Week)**
1. Implement critical CSS inlining
2. Add service worker for caching
3. Optimize JavaScript execution
4. Implement progressive loading

## üíº **Business Justification**

**Executive Impact**: Website performance directly correlates with:
- Professional credibility and attention to detail
- User engagement and time spent reviewing CV
- Mobile accessibility for busy professionals
- Global accessibility for international opportunities

**Competitive Advantage**: Fast-loading CV demonstrates:
- Technical competence and modern development practices
- User experience prioritization
- Performance engineering skills
- Professional polish and completeness

---

**Priority**: üöÄ **High - Direct Impact on Professional Impressions**  
**Timeline**: Critical fixes today, advanced optimizations this week  
**Success Metric**: < 2 second load time on 3G networks

recent_issues.title: üì± Mobile Responsiveness Audit - Critical Professional Credibility Issue
recent_issues.body:
# üöÄ Quick Win: Mobile Responsiveness Audit

## üìä Current Mobile Support Analysis

### ‚úÖ **Existing Mobile Features**
- **Viewport Meta Tag**: ‚úÖ Properly configured
- **Responsive Breakpoints**: ‚úÖ 768px and 480px breakpoints present
- **Typography Scaling**: ‚úÖ Responsive font sizes implemented
- **Grid Layouts**: ‚úÖ Single-column layouts on mobile
- **Print Styles**: ‚úÖ Print optimization implemented
- **Accessibility**: ‚úÖ Reduced motion and high contrast support

### ‚ö†Ô∏è **Critical Mobile Issues Identified**

#### 1. **Incomplete Responsive Coverage**
- **Navigation**: May not be fully mobile-optimized
- **Interactive Elements**: Touch targets may be too small
- **Modal/Dialog Systems**: Mobile optimization unclear
- **Forms**: If present, mobile UX needs verification

#### 2. **Missing Modern Mobile Features**
- **Touch Gestures**: No swipe/gesture support
- **Mobile-First Design**: Appears desktop-first approach
- **Progressive Web App**: No PWA features
- **Mobile Performance**: Bundle size and loading optimization

#### 3. **Professional Mobile Experience Gaps**
- **Business Card Mode**: No compact mobile business card view
- **Share Functionality**: Missing native mobile sharing
- **Contact Integration**: No direct calling/emailing from mobile
- **Offline Support**: No offline viewing capability

## üéØ **Professional Impact Assessment**

### **Critical for Executive/Stakeholder Impressions**
- **70%+ of professional traffic** now comes from mobile devices
- **First impressions** often happen on mobile during commutes/meetings
- **Executive accessibility** requires seamless mobile experience
- **Professional credibility** directly tied to mobile UX quality

## üöÄ **Immediate Improvements Required**

### **Phase 1: Critical Mobile Fixes (Today)**
1. **Touch Target Optimization**: Ensure 44px minimum touch targets
2. **Navigation Enhancement**: Mobile-first navigation experience
3. **Typography Audit**: Optimal mobile reading experience
4. **Performance Testing**: Sub-3-second mobile load times

### **Phase 2: Advanced Mobile Features (This Week)**
1. **Business Card Mode**: Compact mobile-optimized view
2. **Native Mobile Integration**: Direct contact methods
3. **Progressive Web App**: Add to home screen functionality
4. **Mobile Sharing**: Native share API integration

### **Phase 3: Mobile Excellence (Next Week)**
1. **Touch Gestures**: Swipe navigation and interactions
2. **Mobile Analytics**: Mobile-specific user behavior tracking
3. **Offline Support**: Service worker for offline viewing
4. **Mobile Performance**: Advanced optimization and caching

## üì± **Mobile-Specific User Experience Requirements**

### **Executive Mobile Use Cases**
- **Quick Profile Review**: During meetings or interviews
- **Share with Colleagues**: Easy forwarding and sharing
- **Contact Information**: Direct calling/emailing capability
- **Offline Access**: View CV without internet connection

### **Professional Mobile Standards**
- **Load Time**: < 3 seconds on 3G networks
- **Touch Targets**: Minimum 44px for all interactive elements
- **Readable Text**: 16px minimum font size for body text
- **Thumb Navigation**: All key actions within thumb reach

## üîß **Technical Implementation Plan**

### **Responsive Design Audit Checklist**
- [ ] Test all sections on iPhone SE (375px)
- [ ] Test all sections on iPhone Pro (390px) 
- [ ] Test all sections on Android (360px)
- [ ] Test all sections on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets are ‚â•44px
- [ ] Ensure text remains readable without zooming
- [ ] Test horizontal scrolling (should be eliminated)
- [ ] Verify navigation works with thumbs only

### **Performance Mobile Audit**
- [ ] Lighthouse Mobile Performance Score > 90
- [ ] First Contentful Paint < 2 seconds
- [ ] Cumulative Layout Shift < 0.1
- [ ] Bundle size optimization for mobile networks

## üìà **Success Metrics**

### **User Experience KPIs**
- **Mobile Bounce Rate**: < 20% (industry standard)
- **Mobile Session Duration**: > 2 minutes
- **Mobile Interaction Rate**: > 60% of visitors interact
- **Mobile Share Rate**: Measurable social sharing from mobile

### **Technical Performance KPIs**
- **Lighthouse Mobile Score**: > 90 (all categories)
- **Mobile Page Load**: < 3 seconds on 3G
- **Mobile Responsiveness**: 100% Google Mobile-Friendly Test
- **Touch Target Compliance**: 100% elements ‚â•44px

## üíº **Business Justification**

**Professional Impact**: Mobile experience directly affects:
- Executive first impressions during meetings
- Recruiter evaluation while commuting  
- Stakeholder accessibility in various contexts
- Professional credibility and attention to detail

**Competitive Advantage**: Mobile-optimized CV demonstrates:
- Modern development practices awareness
- User experience prioritization
- Professional polish and completeness
- Technical competence across platforms

**Immediate Action Required**: Given the professional context, mobile responsiveness is not optional - it's critical for maintaining professional credibility and maximizing career opportunities.

---

**Priority**: üî• **Critical - Professional Credibility Issue**  
**Timeline**: Fix critical issues today, complete audit this week  
**Impact**: Direct effect on professional opportunities and stakeholder impressions

recent_issues.title: ü•Ω AR/VR Portfolio Showcase - Immersive project demonstrations
recent_issues.body:
# üöÄ Innovation Opportunity: AR/VR Portfolio Showcase

## üéØ Strategic Vision
Create an immersive AR/VR experience that transforms traditional portfolio presentations into interactive, engaging demonstrations of technical projects and professional achievements.

## üî• Business Impact
- **Executive Wow Factor**: Unforgettable stakeholder presentations
- **Technical Differentiation**: Showcase cutting-edge development skills
- **Engagement Revolution**: 10x more memorable than traditional portfolios
- **Future-Ready Positioning**: Align with metaverse and spatial computing trends

## üõ†Ô∏è Technical Implementation

### Core Features
1. **Virtual Project Galleries**
   - 3D project showcases with interactive elements
   - Code visualization in spatial environments
   - Architecture diagrams as explorable 3D models
   - Real-time project demonstrations

2. **Augmented Reality Business Cards**
   - QR code triggers AR CV overlay
   - Floating project previews and achievements
   - Interactive skill demonstrations
   - Real-time GitHub activity visualization

3. **VR Interview Experiences**
   - Virtual office environments for remote interviews
   - Interactive project walk-throughs
   - Collaborative problem-solving spaces
   - Portfolio presentation theaters

### Technical Architecture
- **AR Framework**: AR.js / 8th Wall for web-based AR
- **VR Platform**: WebXR for cross-platform VR experiences
- **3D Graphics**: Three.js for web-based 3D rendering
- **Content Management**: Dynamic loading of portfolio content
- **Device Support**: Mobile AR, VR headsets, desktop experiences

## üìä Success Metrics
- **Engagement Time**: 5x longer than traditional portfolio views
- **Recall Rate**: 90%+ stakeholder recall of demonstrated projects
- **Technical Impression**: "Most innovative portfolio presentation" feedback
- **Platform Compatibility**: Works on 95%+ of target devices

## üîÑ Integration Points
- CV project data drives 3D content generation
- Real-time GitHub activity feeds into AR visualizations
- Multi-format export includes AR/VR experience links
- Analytics track engagement and interaction patterns

## üìà Development Phases
1. **Phase 1**: Basic AR business card with project previews
2. **Phase 2**: VR gallery with interactive project showcases
3. **Phase 3**: Advanced interactions and collaborative features
4. **Phase 4**: AI-powered adaptive presentations

## üé® User Experience Examples
- **AR Business Card**: Scan QR ‚Üí 3D hologram of achievements appears
- **VR Project Tour**: Walk through code architecture in 3D space
- **Mixed Reality Presentation**: Projects float around presenter in real-time
- **Interactive Demos**: Stakeholders manipulate and explore live projects

## üîß Technical Challenges
- Cross-platform compatibility and performance
- 3D content generation from project data
- User experience design for spatial interfaces
- Progressive enhancement for non-AR/VR devices

## üí° Innovation Potential
- First professional CV with full AR/VR integration
- Template system for other developers to adopt
- Industry-leading demonstration of spatial computing skills
- Foundation for metaverse professional presence

**Impact**: üî• Revolutionary
**Complexity**: üß† Expert Level
**Timeline**: 8-10 weeks for comprehensive system

recent_issues.title: üé§ Voice-Activated Updates - Hands-free CV maintenance
recent_issues.body:
# üöÄ Innovation Opportunity: Voice-Activated Updates

## üéØ Strategic Vision
Revolutionary hands-free CV maintenance through advanced voice recognition and AI-powered content generation, enabling effortless professional profile updates.

## üî• Business Impact
- **Accessibility Excellence**: Inclusive design for diverse user needs
- **Efficiency Breakthrough**: Update CV while commuting, exercising, or multitasking
- **Innovation Leadership**: Pioneer voice-first professional development tools
- **User Experience**: Eliminate friction in professional profile maintenance

## üõ†Ô∏è Technical Implementation

### Core Features
1. **Advanced Voice Recognition**
   - Multi-language support (English, Spanish, French, German)
   - Accent adaptation and learning
   - Technical terminology recognition
   - Context-aware interpretation

2. **AI-Powered Content Processing**
   - Natural language to structured data conversion
   - Achievement quantification from voice descriptions
   - Grammar and style optimization
   - Professional tone enhancement

3. **Smart Update Categories**
   - "Add new project: [description]"
   - "Update skills: learned React hooks"
   - "New achievement: led team of 15 developers"
   - "Work experience: promoted to senior architect"

### Technical Architecture
- **Voice Processing**: Web Speech API + Azure Cognitive Services
- **AI Integration**: OpenAI GPT for content structuring and enhancement
- **Real-time Processing**: WebRTC for low-latency voice capture
- **Backend**: Node.js with voice-to-text pipeline
- **Security**: Voice pattern authentication for user verification

## üìä Success Metrics
- **Accuracy**: 95%+ voice recognition accuracy
- **Processing Speed**: < 3 seconds from voice to structured update
- **User Adoption**: 80%+ of users try voice features within first week
- **Quality**: AI-enhanced content matches manual entry quality

## üîÑ Integration Points
- Existing CV data structure updates
- Real-time preview during voice input
- Multi-format export with voice-added content
- Undo/edit capabilities for voice entries

## üìà Development Phases
1. **Phase 1**: Basic voice recognition and simple updates
2. **Phase 2**: AI content enhancement and structuring
3. **Phase 3**: Advanced commands and bulk updates
4. **Phase 4**: Multi-language support and voice authentication

## üé® User Experience
- Push-to-talk or wake-word activation
- Visual feedback during voice processing
- Instant preview of interpreted content
- Voice confirmation before applying changes

## üîß Technical Challenges
- Noise cancellation in various environments
- Technical jargon and industry-specific terms
- Privacy and security of voice data
- Offline capabilities for sensitive updates

**Impact**: üî• Revolutionary
**Complexity**: üß† Advanced
**Timeline**: 5-7 weeks for MVP

recent_issues.title: üîó Blockchain Credential Verification - Cutting-edge professional validation
recent_issues.body:
# üöÄ Innovation Opportunity: Blockchain Credential Verification

## üéØ Strategic Vision
Implement cutting-edge blockchain technology to provide immutable, verifiable credentials and achievements, establishing trust and authenticity in professional qualifications.

## üî• Business Impact
- **Trust & Credibility**: Immutable proof of qualifications and achievements
- **Industry Leadership**: Pioneer blockchain adoption in professional development
- **Future-Proofing**: Align with emerging web3 professional standards
- **Technical Showcase**: Demonstrate advanced blockchain development expertise

## üõ†Ô∏è Technical Implementation

### Core Features
1. **Credential Tokenization**
   - NFT-based achievement certificates
   - Smart contract validation
   - Immutable timestamp verification
   - Multi-signature authority validation

2. **Verification Infrastructure**
   - Public blockchain integration (Ethereum/Polygon)
   - QR code verification system
   - API endpoints for employer verification
   - Decentralized identity (DID) standards

3. **Achievement Categories**
   - Educational qualifications
   - Professional certifications
   - Project completions
   - Skills assessments
   - Work experience validation

### Technical Architecture

labels.name: ci-cd

recent_issues.body:
## Problem
The data-refresh-pipeline.yml workflow cannot be manually triggered due to GitHub Actions not recognizing the workflow_dispatch trigger, returning HTTP 422 errors.

## Root Cause Analysis
- **YAML Syntax**: ‚úÖ APPEARS CORRECT - workflow_dispatch trigger syntax looks valid
- **GitHub Recognition**: ‚ùå FAILING - GitHub API returns "Workflow does not have 'workflow_dispatch' trigger"
- **Workflow Execution**: ‚ùå FAILING - Pipeline fails immediately (0s duration) indicating YAML parsing errors

## Evidence
```bash
$ gh workflow run data-refresh-pipeline.yml --field data_sources=dashboard --field priority_level=high
could not create workflow dispatch event: HTTP 422: Workflow does not have 'workflow_dispatch' trigger
```

Recent workflow runs all fail immediately:
```
completed  failure  üîß Fix data-refresh-pipeline.yml YAML parsing issues  0s
completed  failure  üé¨ Fix Watch Me Work data path - critical timestamp issue resolved  0s  
completed  failure  üîß Fix data-refresh-pipeline.yml workflow_dispatch trigger recognition  0s
```

## Technical Details
- **File**: `.github/workflows/data-refresh-pipeline.yml`
- **Trigger Configuration**: Lines 18-39 contain workflow_dispatch with proper input definitions
- **Issue**: Likely complex YAML structure or hidden characters preventing GitHub from parsing workflow

## Attempted Fixes
1. **Comment Addition**: Added comment to force GitHub workflow re-parsing
2. **Commit Message Simplification**: Removed complex multiline commit message with embedded shell substitutions
3. **Multiple Deployments**: Pushed changes multiple times to trigger GitHub re-recognition

## Impact
- Cannot manually trigger data refresh pipeline
- Limited to scheduled executions only
- Reduces operational flexibility for debugging and urgent updates

## Next Steps
1. **YAML Validation**: Run comprehensive YAML syntax validation
2. **Workflow Recreation**: Consider recreating workflow file from scratch
3. **Complex Structure Review**: Examine job dependencies and multiline strings for parsing issues
4. **GitHub Support**: Check GitHub community forums for similar workflow_dispatch recognition issues

## Files Modified
- `cee0dcd`: Added comment to force trigger recognition
- `1756c1a`: Simplified complex multiline commit message

**Priority**: Medium - Operational convenience issue

labels.description: Related to Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

recent_issues.body:
## Problem
The Watch Me Work data processor successfully generates fresh data but fails to commit it to the repository, leaving the deployed site with stale timestamps.

## Root Cause Analysis
- **Data Path Fix**: ‚úÖ RESOLVED - Fixed data output path from `.github/scripts/data/` to `data/`
- **Data Generation**: ‚úÖ WORKING - Processor successfully generates fresh data (100 activities, 17 repositories, timestamp: 2025-08-01T09:33:56.009Z)
- **Workflow Failure**: ‚ùå FAILING - The `timeout 240 node watch-me-work-data-processor.js` command returns non-zero exit code causing workflow to fail before commit

## Evidence
From workflow logs (run 16671619124):
```
üé¨ Watch Me Work Data Refresh ‚úÖ Watch Me Work data refreshed successfully
üìä Dashboard stats: 100 activities, 17 repositories  
‚è∞ Data timestamp: 2025-08-01T09:33:56.009Z
...
‚ö†Ô∏è Watch Me Work data refresh failed or timed out
```

## Technical Details
- **File**: `.github/scripts/watch-me-work-data-processor.js`
- **Workflow**: `.github/workflows/continuous-enhancement.yml` (watch-me-work-refresh job)
- **Issue**: Exit code handling or timeout behavior preventing successful workflow completion

## Impact
- Current deployed timestamp: `2025-07-31T18:25:11.711Z` (15+ hours stale)
- Fresh data generated but not committed/deployed
- Users see outdated activity information

## Next Steps
1. Investigate exit code handling in watch-me-work-data-processor.js
2. Review timeout behavior (240s limit)
3. Test workflow job completion and commit process
4. Verify data file creation at correct path in CI environment

## Files Modified
- `567ecc6`: Fixed data output path from `.github/scripts/data/` to `data/`

**Priority**: High - User-facing data freshness issue

## **ü§ù Real-Time Collaboration & Feedback System Implementation**

Develop a comprehensive live CV review and collaboration platform that enables stakeholder feedback, version control, and real-time collaborative editing for professional CV optimization.

#### **üë• Live Collaboration Interface**
- **Real-time co-editing** with conflict resolution and simultaneous user support

- **Live cursor tracking** showing collaborator positions and activity status

#### **üìù Feedback Management System**
- **Structured feedback forms** with rating systems and standardized review criteria
- **Approval workflows** with change request management and acceptance/rejection tracking
- **Feedback aggregation** combining multiple reviewer inputs with conflict resolution
- **Historical feedback tracking** showing evolution of suggestions and implementation status

#### **üîÑ Version Control & Change Tracking**
- **Git-like versioning** with branching, merging, and rollback capabilities
- **Change visualization** highlighting additions, deletions, and modifications
- **Approval gates** requiring stakeholder sign-off before major revisions
- **Automated backup system** with recovery and restoration capabilities

#### **üìä Review Analytics & Insights**

- **Collaboration effectiveness** analyzing feedback-to-improvement conversion rates

- **Operational Transform (OT)** algorithms for conflict-free concurrent editing
- **State management** with Redux or similar for complex collaborative state

#### **User Management System**
- **Role-based access control** with granular permissions and feature restrictions
- **Identity verification** with secure authentication and stakeholder validation
- **Notification system** with email, SMS, and in-app messaging integration
- **Privacy controls** with confidentiality settings and access expiration

#### **Integration Architecture**

- **Analytics platform** feeding collaboration data into career intelligence dashboard
- **External calendar** integration for review scheduling and deadline management

### **User Experience Design**

#### **Collaborative Interface**
- **Split-screen view** showing original and edited versions simultaneously
- **Comment threading** with reply chains and resolution status tracking
- **Visual change indicators** with color-coded additions, deletions, and suggestions
- **Mobile collaboration support** enabling review and feedback from any device

#### **Review Management Dashboard**
- **Project overview** with status summaries and pending action items
- **Reviewer assignment** with skill-based matching and availability scheduling
- **Progress tracking** with milestone completion and timeline visualization

- **Time efficiency** with structured feedback collection and implementation guidance
- **Professional network expansion** through meaningful collaboration relationships

#### **For Reviewers & Mentors**

- **Impact visibility** showing contribution to candidate success and career advancement
- **Professional development** through mentoring opportunities and industry networking
- **Recognition system** acknowledging valuable feedback and successful outcomes

#### **For Recruiters & HR**

- **Quality assessment** through collaborative evaluation and multi-perspective feedback
- **Process efficiency** with structured review workflows and automated progress tracking
- **Relationship building** fostering long-term candidate relationships and talent pipeline development

### **Advanced Features**

#### **AI-Enhanced Collaboration**
- **Smart reviewer matching** using AI to identify optimal feedback providers
- **Automated suggestion generation** based on best practices and successful patterns
- **Sentiment analysis** of feedback tone and constructiveness scoring
- **Predictive improvement modeling** forecasting CV enhancement potential

#### **Integration Capabilities**
- **Calendar scheduling** for live review sessions and feedback meetings
- **Video conferencing** integration for real-time discussion and explanation
- **Document comparison** tools showing before/after improvement analysis
- **Export automation** generating reviewer-approved versions for distribution

### **Success Metrics**

- **Review completion rate**: > 85% of requested reviews completed within 48 hours

- **Stakeholder satisfaction**: > 4.5/5 rating for collaboration experience

### **Implementation Phases**

recent_issues.title: üéØ Build Bilateral Stimulation Engine
recent_issues.body:
## Problem
Need to implement the core bilateral stimulation engine that provides visual, auditory, and tactile stimulation patterns essential for EMDR therapy effectiveness.

## Bilateral Stimulation Components

### Visual Stimulation
- **MovingDot** - Smooth horizontal eye movement tracking
- **LightBar** - LED-style light bar with customizable patterns
- **ColorPulse** - Alternating color stimulation (red/blue, etc.)
- **ShapePatterns** - Various geometric shapes for eye tracking
- **CustomVisuals** - User-selectable visual stimulation patterns

### Auditory Stimulation
- **BinauralBeats** - Left/right ear alternating tones
- **NatureSounds** - Calming bilateral nature sounds (rain, waves)
- **ToneGenerator** - Customizable frequency and pattern generator
- **MusicIntegration** - Bilateral music therapy integration
- **VolumeControl** - Independent left/right volume adjustment

### Tactile Stimulation
- **VibrationsAPI** - Mobile device vibration patterns for bilateral stimulation
- **HapticFeedback** - Coordinated haptic patterns for supported devices
- **ExternalDevice** - Integration with EMDR tactile devices (future)
- **CustomPatterns** - User-defined tactile stimulation sequences

### Stimulation Control
- **SpeedControl** - Adjustable stimulation frequency (slow/medium/fast)
- **IntensityControl** - Adjustable stimulation intensity levels
- **PatternSelector** - Different bilateral patterns and rhythms
- **SynchronizedModes** - Multi-modal stimulation coordination

## Advanced Features

### Adaptive Stimulation
- **BiofeedbackIntegration** - Adjust stimulation based on stress indicators
- **ProgressiveSpeed** - Automatically adjust speed based on processing phase
- **PersonalPreferences** - Learn and adapt to user's preferred patterns
- **SafetyAdaptation** - Reduce intensity during high distress periods

### Accessibility Features
- **ColorBlindSupport** - Alternative visual patterns for color blindness
- **HearingImpaired** - Enhanced visual and tactile options
- **MotorImpaired** - Touch-free eye tracking and voice control
- **SensitivityAdjustment** - Accommodate sensory processing differences

### Quality Assurance
- **TimingPrecision** - Millisecond-accurate bilateral timing
- **ConsistentFrameRate** - Smooth 60fps visual stimulation
- **AudioLatency** - Minimized audio delay for precise bilateral timing
- **PerformanceMonitoring** - Real-time performance metrics and optimization

## Backend Integration

### Stimulation Control API
- POST /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/start - Begin bilateral stimulation
- PUT /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/adjust - Modify stimulation parameters
- POST /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/stop - End stimulation sequence
- GET /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/patterns - Get available patterns

### Real-time Synchronization
- WebSocket integration for precise timing coordination
- Multi-device synchronization for coordinated stimulation
- Session-based stimulation state management
- Emergency stop coordination via WebSocket

## Technical Implementation

### Performance Optimization
- **WebGL Rendering** - Hardware-accelerated visual stimulation
- **Web Audio API** - High-quality, low-latency audio processing
- **RequestAnimationFrame** - Smooth visual animations
- **Worker Threads** - Background processing for complex patterns

### Browser Compatibility
- **Progressive Enhancement** - Fallback options for older browsers
- **Mobile Optimization** - Touch-friendly controls and responsive design
- **Cross-platform Testing** - Consistent experience across devices
- **WebRTC Integration** - Real-time audio/video for advanced features

### User Experience
- **Smooth Transitions** - Gradual speed and intensity changes
- **Visual Feedback** - Clear indication of current stimulation settings
- **Quick Controls** - Emergency stop and immediate adjustment options
- **Preference Memory** - Remember user's preferred stimulation settings

## Safety Integration
- Automatic stimulation adjustment during safety alerts
- Emergency stop functionality integrated with safety protocols
- Gentle stimulation modes for highly distressed users
- Integration with agent system for therapeutic timing

## Research and Validation
- Integration with progress tracking for stimulation effectiveness analysis
- A/B testing capabilities for different stimulation patterns
- User feedback collection on stimulation preferences
- Clinical effectiveness metrics and reporting

## Implementation Requirements
1. Build on completed WebSocket infrastructure for real-time control
2. Integrate with session management for automatic stimulation timing
3. Implement comprehensive browser testing for stimulation accuracy
4. Add performance monitoring and optimization for consistent experience
5. Ensure accessibility compliance for diverse user needs
6. Create comprehensive testing suite for stimulation timing precision

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Precise bilateral stimulation timing with millisecond accuracy
- [ ] Multiple stimulation modalities (visual, auditory, tactile) working seamlessly
- [ ] User-customizable stimulation patterns and intensities
- [ ] Real-time stimulation control via WebSocket integration
- [ ] Emergency stop functionality with immediate response
- [ ] Cross-platform compatibility with consistent experience
- [ ] Accessibility features for users with different needs

- **Anonymous Options** - Crisis resources available without identification

- [ ] Automatic safety protocol activation during high-risk situations
- [ ] Professional integration for therapist notifications
- [ ] Comprehensive safety assessment and planning tools
- [ ] Mobile-optimized interface for crisis accessibility
- [ ] Full accessibility compliance for users in distress

üîó **Builds on:** Completed SafetyProtocolService, WebSocket infrastructure, Authentication
üìÖ **Priority:** P0 (Critical for Safety - Must implement alongside session management)
‚è±Ô∏è **Estimated Effort:** 8-10 days

## ‚úÖ **STATUS: COMPLETED** - CI/CD Pipeline Health Restored

**Issue Reference**: Multiple staging deployment failures in CI/CD pipeline  
**Completion Date**: August 1, 2025  
**Resolution**: Critical permission fixes and deployment reliability improvements

---

## üéâ **RESOLUTION SUMMARY**

### **Root Cause Identified**
The primary issue was **missing GitHub Actions permissions**, not ESLint warnings or technical debt. The workflows lacked proper permissions for:
- **Repository Access**:  for git operations
- **GitHub Pages**:  for deployment
- **Authentication**:  for secure deployment tokens

### **Critical Fixes Implemented**

#### üîí **Permission Fixes**
- **continuous-enhancement.yml**: Added 
- **data-refresh-pipeline.yml**: Added  for data commit operations
- **Result**: 403 Permission Denied errors completely eliminated

#### üïí **Deployment Reliability**
- **Fixed commit message timestamp generation** (shell expansion in YAML)
- **Split deployment into preparation + execution steps** for better error handling
- **Enhanced logging and status reporting** for deployment debugging
- **Maintained deployment history** (force_orphan: false) for faster updates

## üìä **Validation Results**

### **Before Fix** (Failure Pattern)


### **After Fix** (Success Confirmed)


## üöÄ **Current System Status**

### **Operational Workflows**
- **Continuous Enhancement**: ‚úÖ Running every hour during business hours
- **Data Refresh Pipeline**: ‚úÖ Running every 30 minutes for fresh data
- **Staging Deployment**: ‚úÖ Live at https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv-staging
- **Quality Gates**: ‚úÖ ESLint passing with manageable warnings

### **Performance Metrics**

recent_issues.title: üìä Bug: 'Watch Me Work' Dashboard Not Displaying Data (Rate Limit)

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

labels.name: P1: High
labels.description: High priority; should be addressed soon

recent_issues.body:
### Problem
The `watch-me-work.html` dashboard, designed to display live GitHub activity, is currently unable to fetch and display data. This is due to its implementation making direct API calls to `api.github.com` from client-side JavaScript (`assets/watch-me-work.js`).

### Root Cause
Client-side direct calls to the GitHub API are subject to severe rate limits (60 requests per hour per IP for unauthenticated requests) and cannot securely utilize Personal Access Tokens (PATs). This leads to rapid exhaustion of the rate limit, preventing data from being loaded. Exposing PATs in client-side code is also a significant security vulnerability.

### Impact
The "Watch Me Work" dashboard is non-functional, failing to provide real-time insights into development activity.

### Current Implementation Analysis
- `assets/watch-me-work.js` contains `loadUserActivity()`, `loadRepositoryData()`, `loadRecentCommits()`, and `loadIssuesAndPRs()` functions that directly `fetch` data from `https://api.github.com`.
- `CONFIG.USERNAME` is hardcoded, and no authentication mechanism is used for these client-side requests.

### Proposed Solution
The `watch-me-work.html` dashboard should be refactored to consume pre-processed GitHub activity data, aligning with the existing architecture where data is collected and processed within the GitHub Actions environment.

**Phase 1: Data Export from CI**
1.  Modify the `activity-analyzer.js` script (or a new dedicated script) to export the relevant GitHub activity data (e.g., recent commits, issues, PRs, repository stats) into a static JSON file (e.g., `data/watch-me-work-data.json`) after each successful CI run.
2.  Ensure this JSON file is committed to the repository and deployed with GitHub Pages.

**Phase 2: Client-Side Consumption**
1.  Update `assets/watch-me-work.js` to fetch data from this static `data/watch-me-work-data.json` file instead of making direct GitHub API calls.
2.  Implement client-side filtering and display logic based on this pre-processed data.

This approach will:
-   Resolve GitHub API rate limit issues for the dashboard.
-   Eliminate security risks associated with client-side API key exposure.
-   Ensure the dashboard always displays the latest data processed by the CI pipeline.

### Acceptance Criteria
- `watch-me-work.html` dashboard successfully loads and displays GitHub activity data.
- No direct GitHub API calls are made from `assets/watch-me-work.js`.
- GitHub activity data is pre-processed and served statically.

### Priority
P1: High (Dashboard is a key visualization feature and currently non-functional).

recent_issues.title: üé§ Bug: Voice interface functionality broken - permission and initialization issues

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: Features or bugs related to accessibility (WCAG, ARIA, etc.)

recent_issues.body:
## üêõ **Voice Interface Failure Report**

The voice functionality in the terminal interface is currently broken and not working as expected. Users cannot activate voice commands or speech output.

### üîç **Problem Description**

**Current Status:** Voice interface fails to initialize or function properly
**User Impact:** Complete loss of voice command functionality and accessibility features
**Severity:** High - affects accessibility and core advertised features

### üõ† **Affected Components**

**Files Involved:**
- `assets/voice-interface.js` - Main voice interface class
- `assets/terminal.js` - Voice integration and command handling
- `index.html` - Voice control UI elements

**UI Elements:**
- Voice toggle button (`#voiceToggle`)
- Speech output button (`#speechToggle`) 
- Voice status indicator (`#voiceIndicator`)
- Voice status display (`#voiceStatus`)

### üîç **Root Cause Analysis**

#### **1. Browser API Requirements**
- **Web Speech API** requires HTTPS connection
- **Microphone permissions** must be explicitly granted
- **User gesture** required for speech synthesis (autoplay policies)
- **Browser compatibility** limited to Chrome/Edge primarily

#### **2. Permission Handling Issues**
```javascript
// Current error handling in voice-interface.js:182-192
this.recognition.onerror = (event) => {
  console.warn('Speech recognition error:', event.error);
  
  if (event.error === 'not-allowed' || event.error === 'service-not-allowed') {
    this.showVoiceError('Microphone access required for voice interface');
  } else if (event.error === 'network') {
    this.showVoiceError('Network error - check internet connection');
  }
};
```

#### **3. Initialization Sequence Problems**
- Voice interface initialization may fail silently
- No graceful degradation when APIs unavailable
- Missing error feedback to user
- Auto-restart logic may cause infinite loops

### üß™ **Expected vs Actual Behavior**

**Expected:**
- Voice toggle button activates listening
- Wake words ("Adrian", "Computer") trigger command mode
- Speech recognition converts voice to terminal commands
- Text-to-speech provides audio feedback
- Proper error messages for permission issues

**Actual:**
- Voice interface fails to start
- No response to voice commands
- UI indicators show error states
- Console shows permission or API errors

### üìã **Debugging Steps Performed**

#### **Browser API Support Check:**
```javascript
// APIs required for voice functionality:
- window.SpeechRecognition || window.webkitSpeechRecognition
- window.speechSynthesis
- window.SpeechSynthesisUtterance
```

#### **Common Failure Points:**
1. **Microphone Permissions:** Not requested or denied
2. **HTTPS Requirement:** Web Speech API requires secure context
3. **Browser Support:** Limited to Chromium-based browsers
4. **Network Connectivity:** Speech recognition needs internet
5. **User Gesture:** Required for speech synthesis to work

### üîß **Proposed Solutions**

#### **1. Enhanced Permission Handling**
- Add explicit permission request flow
- Improve error messaging and user guidance
- Graceful fallback when permissions denied

#### **2. Initialization Improvements**
- Better API availability detection
- User-friendly error reporting
- Progressive enhancement approach

#### **3. Browser Compatibility**
- Add browser support detection
- Show compatibility warnings
- Provide alternative interaction methods

#### **4. User Experience Fixes**
- Clear onboarding for voice setup
- Visual feedback for permission states
- Better error recovery mechanisms

### üß™ **Testing Requirements**

**Test Cases Needed:**
- [ ] Permission request flow
- [ ] HTTPS vs HTTP behavior  
- [ ] Different browser compatibility
- [ ] Network connectivity issues
- [ ] Microphone hardware problems
- [ ] Speech synthesis voice loading
- [ ] Wake word detection accuracy
- [ ] Command recognition precision

### üí° **Implementation Priority**

**High Priority:**
1. Fix permission request flow
2. Add proper error handling
3. Improve user feedback

**Medium Priority:**
1. Browser compatibility warnings
2. Enhanced wake word detection
3. Voice command accuracy

**Low Priority:**
1. Advanced voice settings
2. Multiple language support
3. Voice training features

### üìà **Success Criteria**

- [ ] Voice interface initializes without errors
- [ ] Microphone permissions properly requested
- [ ] Clear error messages for common issues
- [ ] Wake word detection functional
- [ ] Voice commands execute correctly
- [ ] Speech output works as expected
- [ ] Graceful degradation when unavailable

### üîó **Related Issues**

This issue is related to the overall accessibility and usability of the terminal interface. Voice functionality is a core feature that affects user experience significantly.

---

**Priority:** High
**Type:** Bug Fix
**Component:** Voice Interface
**Accessibility Impact:** Severe

recent_issues.title: Add test framework and comprehensive test cases
recent_issues.body:
## Summary
Implement a proper testing framework for the music sorter script to ensure reliability and catch regressions during development.

## Background
From `CLAUDE.md`:
> **Testing:** No formal test framework is currently implemented. Testing should be done with:
> 1. Dry-run mode first (`./music_sorter.sh`)
> 2. Small test directories before processing large collections
> 3. Review log files in detail before using `--move` flag

This manual testing approach needs to be supplemented with automated tests.

## Requirements

### Test Framework Setup
- **Bash testing framework**: Consider `bats-core` (Bash Automated Testing System)
- **Test directory structure**: Organized test cases with sample music files
- **CI Integration**: Ensure tests run automatically on commits/PRs

### Test Categories Needed

#### 1. **Unit Tests**
- `sanitize_filename()`: Test filename sanitization with various problematic characters
- `check_dependencies()`: Mock missing dependencies
- `get_log_level_name()`: Test all log level mappings
- Metadata parsing functions

#### 2. **Integration Tests**  
- **Album processing**: Test complete album analysis workflow
- **Quality detection**: Test Lossless/Lossy/Mixed classification
- **Path generation**: Test target directory structure creation
- **Error handling**: Test problematic albums (missing metadata, etc.)

#### 3. **End-to-End Tests**
- **Dry-run mode**: Verify no actual file changes occur
- **Complete workflow**: Source ‚Üí Analysis ‚Üí Target path planning
- **Configuration loading**: Test config file parsing and CLI overrides
- **Logging**: Verify log file content and format

#### 4. **Edge Case Tests**
- **Various Artists** compilations
- **Multi-disc albums** 
- **Special characters** in metadata (Unicode, symbols)
- **Missing/inconsistent metadata**
- **Mixed file formats** within albums
- **Empty directories**
- **Symbolic links**

### Test Data Requirements
Create test music collection with:
- Sample albums with good metadata
- Albums with missing/bad metadata  
- Multi-disc albums
- Various Artists compilations
- Mixed quality albums (FLAC + MP3)
- Files with problematic characters in names/metadata

## Implementation Plan
1. **Choose testing framework** (recommend `bats-core`)
2. **Create `tests/` directory** structure
3. **Generate test music files** (or use Creative Commons samples)
4. **Write test cases** for each component
5. **Add CI workflow** (GitHub Actions)
6. **Document testing process** in README

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Automated test framework is set up and functional
- [ ] Unit tests cover all core functions
- [ ] Integration tests verify album processing workflow
- [ ] End-to-end tests validate complete dry-run operations
- [ ] Edge cases are properly tested
- [ ] Tests run in CI/CD pipeline
- [ ] Test coverage report is available
- [ ] Documentation explains how to run tests

## Benefits
- **Catch regressions** during development
- **Validate fixes** before deployment
- **Document expected behavior** through test cases
- **Enable confident refactoring**
- **Ensure cross-platform compatibility**

recent_issues.title: Implement conflict resolution for existing target paths
recent_issues.body:
## Summary
Implement robust conflict resolution when target album directories or files already exist, as specified in the project specifications.

## Background
From `SPECIFICATIONS.md`:
> **Conflict Resolution:** If a target path already exists, the script will:
> - **If identical:** Skip the move/rename operation and log it as skipped.
> - **If different but same name:** Append a unique identifier (e.g., `_1`, `_2`) to the album folder name to prevent overwriting. A warning will be logged.

## Current State
The specifications mention conflict resolution but it's not implemented. The script will need to handle cases where organized music already exists.

## Requirements
Implement conflict resolution logic that:

1. **Check for existing paths**: Before moving, verify if target directory/files exist
2. **Identical content detection**: Compare files to determine if they're the same
3. **Naming conflict resolution**: 
   - Append `_1`, `_2`, etc. to album directory names
   - Handle both directory and file name conflicts
4. **User feedback**: Log all conflict resolution decisions
5. **Skip identical files**: Don't re-process files that are already in place

## Implementation Details

### New Functions Needed
- `check_path_conflicts(proposed_path)`: Check if target exists
- `resolve_naming_conflict(base_path)`: Generate unique directory name
- `files_are_identical(file1, file2)`: Compare file content/metadata

### Integration Points
- Add conflict checking before file move operations
- Integrate with the move functionality (Issue #2)
- Update path planning logic to account for resolved conflicts

### Conflict Resolution Strategy
1. **For Album Directories**:
   ```bash
   # If "Artist/Album (2020)" exists, try:
   # "Artist/Album (2020)_1"
   # "Artist/Album (2020)_2" 
   # etc.
   ```

2. **For Individual Files**:
   - Compare checksums to detect identical files
   - Skip if identical, rename if different

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detects when target paths already exist
- [ ] Compares existing files to determine if identical
- [ ] Generates unique directory names when conflicts occur
- [ ] Logs all conflict resolution decisions
- [ ] Skips processing of identical files/albums
- [ ] Prevents accidental overwriting of existing organized music
- [ ] Works with both dry-run and live modes

## Dependencies
- File move functionality from Issue #2
- Checksum verification from Issue #3 (for identical file detection)

recent_issues.title: Add checksum verification for file integrity
recent_issues.body:
## Summary
Implement checksum verification to ensure file integrity during move operations, as specified in the project specifications.

## Background
From `SPECIFICATIONS.md`:
> **Checksum Verification:** After moving a file, its integrity will be verified using a checksum (e.g., MD5). Mismatches will be logged as errors, and the original file will be retained if possible.

## Requirements
Add checksum verification functionality that:

1. **Calculate checksums before moving**: Generate MD5 checksums for source files
2. **Verify after moving**: Calculate checksums for moved files and compare
3. **Handle mismatches**: 
   - Log errors when checksums don't match
   - Retain original file if possible
   - Mark operation as failed
4. **Integration**: Work seamlessly with the file move functionality

## Implementation Approach
1. **New function**: `verify_file_integrity(source_file, dest_file)`
2. **Use `md5sum`**: Already listed as dependency in `check_dependencies()`
3. **Add to move workflow**: Call verification after each successful file move
4. **Error handling**: Proper logging and rollback on verification failures

## Suggested Implementation Location
- Add `verify_file_integrity()` function around `music_sorter.sh:87`
- Integrate into the actual move logic (Issue #2)
- Add verification step after each `rsync` operation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Calculates MD5 checksums before and after file moves
- [ ] Compares checksums and detects mismatches
- [ ] Logs verification results (success/failure) 
- [ ] Retains original files when verification fails
- [ ] Reports integrity issues to user
- [ ] Does not break existing dry-run functionality
- [ ] Integrates cleanly with file move operations

## Dependencies
- `md5sum` (already verified in dependencies)
- File move functionality from Issue #2

recent_issues.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Follow-up: Schema Validation Failures (Task 3)
recent_issues.body: Issue #115 (Normalize and validate enriched metadata) was marked as done, but the `tools/validate_all.py` script reports schema validation failures for many files in `enriched_outputs/`. The primary error is 'name: Field required'. This indicates that the normalization and validation process is not correctly handling the schema, likely due to upstream issues in the enrichment process. This needs to be investigated and fixed.

recent_issues.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Follow-up: Incomplete LLM Enrichment (Task 2)
recent_issues.body: Issue #114 (Enrich model metadata with LLM) was marked as done, but the enriched output files (`enriched_outputs/*.json`) are missing critical fields like `name`, `summary`, `use_cases`, `strengths`, and `weaknesses`. This indicates the LLM enrichment process is not fully functional or the output format is incorrect, leading to schema validation failures. This needs to be investigated and fixed.

# üöÄ Quick Win: Performance Optimization

## üéØ **Performance Goals**
- **Load Time**: < 2 seconds for stakeholder impressions  
- **Lighthouse Score**: 90+ across all categories
- **First Contentful Paint**: < 1.5 seconds
- **Cumulative Layout Shift**: < 0.1

## üìä **Current Performance Analysis**

### **Critical Performance Factors**
1. **Font Loading**: Google Fonts (Inter + JetBrains Mono)
2. **CSS Bundle Size**: Large stylesheet needs optimization
3. **JavaScript Execution**: Interactive features and animations
4. **Image Optimization**: Profile images and assets
5. **Resource Loading**: Preloading and critical resource prioritization

### **Professional Impact**
- **Executive Attention Span**: 3-second rule for professional websites
- **First Impressions**: Performance directly affects perceived competence
- **Mobile Networks**: 3G/4G performance critical for mobile professionals
- **International Access**: CDN and global performance considerations

## üîß **Immediate Optimizations Required**

### **Phase 1: Critical Resource Optimization**
1. **Font Loading Strategy**
   - Implement font-display: swap for faster rendering
   - Preload critical fonts
   - Consider font subsetting for faster downloads

2. **CSS Optimization**
   - Critical CSS inlining for above-the-fold content
   - Defer non-critical CSS
   - Remove unused CSS rules
   - Minify CSS in production

3. **JavaScript Performance**
   - Defer non-critical JavaScript
   - Optimize animation performance
   - Implement efficient event handling
   - Bundle optimization and tree shaking

### **Phase 2: Advanced Performance**
1. **Resource Preloading**
   - Preload critical resources
   - Implement resource hints (dns-prefetch, preconnect)
   - Optimize loading sequence

2. **Caching Strategy**
   - Browser caching optimization
   - Service worker for offline performance
   - CDN integration for global performance

3. **Image Optimization**
   - WebP format support with fallbacks
   - Responsive images for different screen sizes
   - Lazy loading for non-critical images

## üìà **Performance Metrics Tracking**

### **Core Web Vitals**
- **Largest Contentful Paint (LCP)**: < 2.5s
- **First Input Delay (FID)**: < 100ms  
- **Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS)**: < 0.1

### **Additional Performance KPIs**
- **Time to First Byte (TTFB)**: < 200ms
- **First Contentful Paint (FCP)**: < 1.5s
- **Speed Index**: < 2.0s
- **Total Blocking Time (TBT)**: < 300ms

## üõ†Ô∏è **Implementation Plan**

### **Immediate Fixes (Today)**
1. Add font-display: swap to font loading
2. Implement preconnect for external resources
3. Optimize CSS delivery strategy
4. Add resource hints for performance

### **Advanced Optimizations (This Week)**
1. Implement critical CSS inlining
2. Add service worker for caching
3. Optimize JavaScript execution
4. Implement progressive loading

## üíº **Business Justification**

- Professional credibility and attention to detail
- User engagement and time spent reviewing CV
- Mobile accessibility for busy professionals
- Global accessibility for international opportunities

**Competitive Advantage**: Fast-loading CV demonstrates:
- Technical competence and modern development practices
- User experience prioritization
- Performance engineering skills
- Professional polish and completeness

data.title: üîß data-refresh-pipeline.yml workflow_dispatch trigger not recognized

labels.name: ci-cd
labels.description: Related to Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

data.body:
## Problem
The data-refresh-pipeline.yml workflow cannot be manually triggered due to GitHub Actions not recognizing the workflow_dispatch trigger, returning HTTP 422 errors.

## Root Cause Analysis
- **YAML Syntax**: ‚úÖ APPEARS CORRECT - workflow_dispatch trigger syntax looks valid
- **GitHub Recognition**: ‚ùå FAILING - GitHub API returns "Workflow does not have 'workflow_dispatch' trigger"
- **Workflow Execution**: ‚ùå FAILING - Pipeline fails immediately (0s duration) indicating YAML parsing errors

## Evidence
```bash
$ gh workflow run data-refresh-pipeline.yml --field data_sources=dashboard --field priority_level=high
could not create workflow dispatch event: HTTP 422: Workflow does not have 'workflow_dispatch' trigger
```

Recent workflow runs all fail immediately:
```
completed  failure  üîß Fix data-refresh-pipeline.yml YAML parsing issues  0s
completed  failure  üé¨ Fix Watch Me Work data path - critical timestamp issue resolved  0s  
completed  failure  üîß Fix data-refresh-pipeline.yml workflow_dispatch trigger recognition  0s
```

## Technical Details
- **File**: `.github/workflows/data-refresh-pipeline.yml`
- **Trigger Configuration**: Lines 18-39 contain workflow_dispatch with proper input definitions
- **Issue**: Likely complex YAML structure or hidden characters preventing GitHub from parsing workflow

## Attempted Fixes
1. **Comment Addition**: Added comment to force GitHub workflow re-parsing
2. **Commit Message Simplification**: Removed complex multiline commit message with embedded shell substitutions
3. **Multiple Deployments**: Pushed changes multiple times to trigger GitHub re-recognition

## Impact
- Cannot manually trigger data refresh pipeline
- Limited to scheduled executions only
- Reduces operational flexibility for debugging and urgent updates

## Next Steps
1. **YAML Validation**: Run comprehensive YAML syntax validation
2. **Workflow Recreation**: Consider recreating workflow file from scratch
3. **Complex Structure Review**: Examine job dependencies and multiline strings for parsing issues
4. **GitHub Support**: Check GitHub community forums for similar workflow_dispatch recognition issues

## Files Modified
- `cee0dcd`: Added comment to force trigger recognition
- `1756c1a`: Simplified complex multiline commit message

**Priority**: Medium - Operational convenience issue

timeline._formatted: Issue #126: üîß data-refresh-pipeline.yml workflow_dispatch trigger not recognized

data.title: üé¨ Watch Me Work data processor workflow commit failure

labels.name: ci-cd
labels.description: Related to Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

data.body:
## Problem
The Watch Me Work data processor successfully generates fresh data but fails to commit it to the repository, leaving the deployed site with stale timestamps.

## Root Cause Analysis
- **Data Path Fix**: ‚úÖ RESOLVED - Fixed data output path from `.github/scripts/data/` to `data/`
- **Data Generation**: ‚úÖ WORKING - Processor successfully generates fresh data (100 activities, 17 repositories, timestamp: 2025-08-01T09:33:56.009Z)
- **Workflow Failure**: ‚ùå FAILING - The `timeout 240 node watch-me-work-data-processor.js` command returns non-zero exit code causing workflow to fail before commit

## Evidence
From workflow logs (run 16671619124):
```
üé¨ Watch Me Work Data Refresh ‚úÖ Watch Me Work data refreshed successfully
üìä Dashboard stats: 100 activities, 17 repositories  
‚è∞ Data timestamp: 2025-08-01T09:33:56.009Z
...
‚ö†Ô∏è Watch Me Work data refresh failed or timed out
```

## Technical Details
- **File**: `.github/scripts/watch-me-work-data-processor.js`
- **Workflow**: `.github/workflows/continuous-enhancement.yml` (watch-me-work-refresh job)
- **Issue**: Exit code handling or timeout behavior preventing successful workflow completion

## Impact
- Current deployed timestamp: `2025-07-31T18:25:11.711Z` (15+ hours stale)
- Fresh data generated but not committed/deployed
- Users see outdated activity information

## Next Steps
1. Investigate exit code handling in watch-me-work-data-processor.js
2. Review timeout behavior (240s limit)
3. Test workflow job completion and commit process
4. Verify data file creation at correct path in CI environment

## Files Modified
- `567ecc6`: Fixed data output path from `.github/scripts/data/` to `data/`

**Priority**: High - User-facing data freshness issue

data.title: ü§ù Real-Time Collaboration & Feedback System - Live CV Review Platform
data.body:
## **ü§ù Real-Time Collaboration & Feedback System Implementation**

Develop a comprehensive live CV review and collaboration platform that enables stakeholder feedback, version control, and real-time collaborative editing for professional CV optimization.

### **Core Features Required**

#### **üë• Live Collaboration Interface**
- **Real-time co-editing** with conflict resolution and simultaneous user support
- **Stakeholder role management** including recruiters, mentors, peers, and hiring managers
- **Comment and annotation system** with contextual feedback and suggestion tracking
- **Live cursor tracking** showing collaborator positions and activity status

#### **üìù Feedback Management System**
- **Structured feedback forms** with rating systems and standardized review criteria
- **Approval workflows** with change request management and acceptance/rejection tracking
- **Feedback aggregation** combining multiple reviewer inputs with conflict resolution
- **Historical feedback tracking** showing evolution of suggestions and implementation status

#### **üîÑ Version Control & Change Tracking**
- **Git-like versioning** with branching, merging, and rollback capabilities
- **Change visualization** highlighting additions, deletions, and modifications
- **Approval gates** requiring stakeholder sign-off before major revisions
- **Automated backup system** with recovery and restoration capabilities

#### **üìä Review Analytics & Insights**
- **Reviewer engagement metrics** tracking participation and feedback quality
- **Content improvement scoring** measuring CV enhancement over iteration cycles
- **Collaboration effectiveness** analyzing feedback-to-improvement conversion rates
- **Stakeholder satisfaction tracking** with survey integration and sentiment analysis

### **Technical Implementation Requirements**

#### **Real-Time Infrastructure**
- **WebSocket implementation** for instant synchronization and low-latency updates
- **Operational Transform (OT)** algorithms for conflict-free concurrent editing
- **State management** with Redux or similar for complex collaborative state
- **Offline capability** with local storage and sync-on-reconnect functionality

#### **User Management System**
- **Role-based access control** with granular permissions and feature restrictions
- **Identity verification** with secure authentication and stakeholder validation
- **Notification system** with email, SMS, and in-app messaging integration
- **Privacy controls** with confidentiality settings and access expiration

#### **Integration Architecture**
- **CV export system** connecting with existing multi-format export capabilities
- **Personalization engine** integrating feedback into AI-driven improvements
- **Analytics platform** feeding collaboration data into career intelligence dashboard
- **External calendar** integration for review scheduling and deadline management

### **User Experience Design**

#### **Collaborative Interface**
- **Split-screen view** showing original and edited versions simultaneously
- **Comment threading** with reply chains and resolution status tracking
- **Visual change indicators** with color-coded additions, deletions, and suggestions

data.title: üéØ Build Bilateral Stimulation Engine
data.body:
## Problem
Need to implement the core bilateral stimulation engine that provides visual, auditory, and tactile stimulation patterns essential for EMDR therapy effectiveness.

## Bilateral Stimulation Components

### Visual Stimulation
- **MovingDot** - Smooth horizontal eye movement tracking
- **LightBar** - LED-style light bar with customizable patterns
- **ColorPulse** - Alternating color stimulation (red/blue, etc.)
- **ShapePatterns** - Various geometric shapes for eye tracking
- **CustomVisuals** - User-selectable visual stimulation patterns

### Auditory Stimulation
- **BinauralBeats** - Left/right ear alternating tones
- **NatureSounds** - Calming bilateral nature sounds (rain, waves)
- **ToneGenerator** - Customizable frequency and pattern generator
- **MusicIntegration** - Bilateral music therapy integration
- **VolumeControl** - Independent left/right volume adjustment

### Tactile Stimulation
- **VibrationsAPI** - Mobile device vibration patterns for bilateral stimulation
- **HapticFeedback** - Coordinated haptic patterns for supported devices
- **ExternalDevice** - Integration with EMDR tactile devices (future)
- **CustomPatterns** - User-defined tactile stimulation sequences

### Stimulation Control
- **SpeedControl** - Adjustable stimulation frequency (slow/medium/fast)
- **IntensityControl** - Adjustable stimulation intensity levels
- **PatternSelector** - Different bilateral patterns and rhythms
- **SynchronizedModes** - Multi-modal stimulation coordination

## Advanced Features

### Adaptive Stimulation
- **BiofeedbackIntegration** - Adjust stimulation based on stress indicators
- **ProgressiveSpeed** - Automatically adjust speed based on processing phase
- **PersonalPreferences** - Learn and adapt to user's preferred patterns
- **SafetyAdaptation** - Reduce intensity during high distress periods

### Accessibility Features
- **ColorBlindSupport** - Alternative visual patterns for color blindness
- **HearingImpaired** - Enhanced visual and tactile options
- **MotorImpaired** - Touch-free eye tracking and voice control
- **SensitivityAdjustment** - Accommodate sensory processing differences

### Quality Assurance
- **TimingPrecision** - Millisecond-accurate bilateral timing
- **ConsistentFrameRate** - Smooth 60fps visual stimulation
- **AudioLatency** - Minimized audio delay for precise bilateral timing
- **PerformanceMonitoring** - Real-time performance metrics and optimization

## Backend Integration

### Stimulation Control API
- POST /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/start - Begin bilateral stimulation
- PUT /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/adjust - Modify stimulation parameters
- POST /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/stop - End stimulation sequence
- GET /api/sessions/:id/stimulation/patterns - Get available patterns

### Real-time Synchronization
- WebSocket integration for precise timing coordination
- Multi-device synchronization for coordinated stimulation
- Session-based stimulation state management
- Emergency stop coordination via WebSocket

## Technical Implementation

### Performance Optimization
- **WebGL Rendering** - Hardware-accelerated visual stimulation
- **Web Audio API** - High-quality, low-latency audio processing
- **RequestAnimationFrame** - Smooth visual animations
- **Worker Threads** - Background processing for complex patterns

### Browser Compatibility
- **Progressive Enhancement** - Fallback options for older browsers
- **Mobile Optimization** - Touch-friendly controls and responsive design
- **Cross-platform Testing** - Consistent experience across devices
- **WebRTC Integration** - Real-time audio/video for advanced features

### User Experience
- **Smooth Transitions** - Gradual speed and intensity changes
- **Visual Feedback** - Clear indication of current stimulation settings
- **Quick Controls** - Emergency stop and immediate adjustment options
- **Preference Memory** - Remember user's preferred stimulation settings

## Safety Integration
- Automatic stimulation adjustment during safety alerts
- Emergency stop functionality integrated with safety protocols
- Gentle stimulation modes for highly distressed users
- Integration with agent system for therapeutic timing

## Research and Validation
- Integration with progress tracking for stimulation effectiveness analysis
- A/B testing capabilities for different stimulation patterns
- User feedback collection on stimulation preferences
- Clinical effectiveness metrics and reporting

## Implementation Requirements
1. Build on completed WebSocket infrastructure for real-time control
2. Integrate with session management for automatic stimulation timing
3. Implement comprehensive browser testing for stimulation accuracy
4. Add performance monitoring and optimization for consistent experience
5. Ensure accessibility compliance for diverse user needs
6. Create comprehensive testing suite for stimulation timing precision

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Precise bilateral stimulation timing with millisecond accuracy
- [ ] Multiple stimulation modalities (visual, auditory, tactile) working seamlessly
- [ ] User-customizable stimulation patterns and intensities
- [ ] Real-time stimulation control via WebSocket integration
- [ ] Emergency stop functionality with immediate response
- [ ] Cross-platform compatibility with consistent experience
- [ ] Accessibility features for users with different needs
- [ ] Performance optimization for smooth, uninterrupted stimulation
- [ ] Integration with safety monitoring for adaptive stimulation

üîó **Depends on:** Session management interface (Issue #17), WebSocket infrastructure
üìÖ **Priority:** P1 (Core EMDR Feature - Essential for therapy effectiveness)
‚è±Ô∏è **Estimated Effort:** 10-12 days

üìä **Research Note:** This component directly impacts EMDR therapy effectiveness and requires validation with clinical research on bilateral stimulation patterns.

data.title: üõ°Ô∏è Build Safety Monitoring Interface with Live Alerts
data.body:
## Problem
Need comprehensive safety monitoring interface that provides real-time safety alerts and crisis intervention tools, building on the completed SafetyProtocolService.

## Safety Interface Components

### Real-time Safety Monitoring
- **SafetyDashboard** - Live safety status with SUD tracking and trend analysis
- **DistressAlert** - Immediate visual/audio alerts for safety threshold breaches
- **SafetyMeter** - Real-time SUD display with color-coded risk levels
- **TrendAnalysis** - Visual graphs of distress progression during session

### Crisis Intervention Interface
- **EmergencyButton** - Large, accessible crisis intervention trigger
- **CrisisResources** - Immediate access to professional help (988, Crisis Text Line)
- **EmergencyContacts** - Quick dial/message emergency contacts
- **HospitalLocator** - Nearest mental health facilities with directions

### Grounding and Stabilization
- **GroundingExercises** - Interactive stabilization techniques library
- **BreathingGuide** - Guided breathing exercises with visual/audio cues
- **SafePlaceVisualization** - Calming imagery and safe place techniques
- **FiveThingsTechnique** - Interactive 5-4-3-2-1 grounding exercise

### Safety Assessment Tools
- **QuickSafetyCheck** - Rapid safety assessment questionnaire
- **DissociationMonitor** - Detect and respond to dissociative episodes
- **RiskAssessment** - Comprehensive safety evaluation tools
- **SafetyPlan** - Personalized safety plan creation and review

### Professional Integration
- **TherapistAlert** - Notify designated professional therapists
- **CrisisTeamContact** - Direct connection to crisis intervention teams
- **EmergencyDispatch** - Integration with emergency services if needed
- **ProfessionalReferrals** - Immediate access to mental health professionals

## Backend Safety Integration

### Real-time Safety Monitoring
- Leverage completed SafetyProtocolService for automatic monitoring
- WebSocket integration for instant safety alerts and status updates
- Continuous SUD monitoring with configurable thresholds
- Automatic safety protocol activation at SUD ‚â• 8 or rapid increase ‚â• 3

### Safety API Endpoints
- POST /api/safety/manual-check - User-initiated safety assessment
- GET /api/safety/status - Current safety status and recommendations
- POST /api/safety/emergency - Trigger emergency protocols
- POST /api/safety/grounding - Log grounding technique usage
- GET /api/safety/resources - Get crisis resources and contacts

## Safety Store Implementation
Create SafetyStore in Zustand for:
- Current safety status and risk level
- Safety check history and trends
- Emergency contact information
- Crisis protocol activation state
- Grounding technique progress and effectiveness

## Critical Safety Features

### Automatic Interventions
- **SUD Threshold Alerts** - Immediate alerts when SUD reaches dangerous levels
- **Rapid Escalation Detection** - Monitor for sudden distress increases
- **Session Pause Triggers** - Automatic session pause for safety assessments
- **Agent Safety Coordination** - Agents automatically shift to safety protocols

### Accessibility and Usability
- **Large Touch Targets** - Emergency buttons sized for distressed users
- **High Contrast Alerts** - Visual alerts visible during dissociation
- **Voice Commands** - Hands-free emergency activation
- **Simple Language** - Clear, non-clinical language during crisis

### Privacy and Security
- **Encrypted Communication** - All crisis communications encrypted
- **Selective Disclosure** - User control over information shared with professionals
- **Anonymous Options** - Crisis resources available without identification
- **Data Protection** - HIPAA-compliant handling of safety data

## Integration Requirements
1. Build on completed SafetyProtocolService and WebSocket infrastructure
2. Integrate with session management for automatic safety monitoring
3. Connect with agent system for coordinated safety responses
4. Implement geolocation for nearest crisis resources
5. Add comprehensive logging for safety interventions and outcomes
6. Ensure 24/7 availability and reliability for crisis situations

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Real-time safety monitoring with configurable alert thresholds
- [ ] One-click access to crisis resources and emergency contacts
- [ ] Interactive grounding exercises with progress tracking
- [ ] Automatic safety protocol activation during high-risk situations
- [ ] Professional integration for therapist notifications
- [ ] Comprehensive safety assessment and planning tools
- [ ] Mobile-optimized interface for crisis accessibility
- [ ] Full accessibility compliance for users in distress

üîó **Builds on:** Completed SafetyProtocolService, WebSocket infrastructure, Authentication
üìÖ **Priority:** P0 (Critical for Safety - Must implement alongside session management)
‚è±Ô∏è **Estimated Effort:** 8-10 days

‚ö†Ô∏è **CRITICAL NOTE:** This interface handles life-threatening situations and must be thoroughly tested with mental health professionals before deployment.

data.body:
## Problem
No state management exists. Need centralized state for session data, user auth, and real-time features.

## Required Zustand Stores

### AuthStore
- User authentication state
- JWT token management
- Login/logout actions
- User profile data

### SessionStore
- Current EMDR session state
- Phase progression tracking
- SUD/VOC measurements
- Session history
- Bilateral stimulation settings

### AgentStore
- Active agents in session
- Message history with agents
- Agent coordination state
- Response waiting states

### SafetyStore
- Current safety status
- Safety check history
- Emergency contact info
- Crisis protocol state

### UIStore
- Modal states
- Loading states
- Error messages
- Notification queue
- Theme/preferences

## Implementation Requirements
1. Use Zustand with TypeScript integration
2. Implement persistence for critical state (auth, preferences)
3. Add devtools integration for debugging
4. Use immer for complex state updates
5. Implement optimistic updates for better UX
6. Add state hydration and error recovery

## Store Integration
- Connect to WebSocket for real-time updates
- Integrate with API services for data persistence
- Handle offline state gracefully
- Implement state synchronization between tabs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All stores fully typed with comprehensive interfaces
- [ ] Persistent state survives page refresh
- [ ] Real-time state updates via WebSocket
- [ ] Proper error handling and recovery
- [ ] DevTools integration working
- [ ] State management performance optimized

- **SessionDashboard** - Main session interface
- **PhaseIndicator** - Current EMDR phase display
- **BilateralStimulation** - Visual/audio/tactile stimulation
- **SUVOCMeter** - SUD/VOC measurement tools

### Agent Interface Components

### Progress Components
- **SessionHistory** - Past sessions view

## Implementation Requirements

data.title: üîå Implement Backend API Controllers and Routes
data.body:
## Problem
The backend has no API endpoints beyond the health check. Need complete REST API for frontend integration.

## Missing API Endpoints

### Authentication
- POST /api/auth/login
- POST /api/auth/register
- POST /api/auth/logout
- GET /api/auth/me

### User Management
- GET /api/users/profile
- PUT /api/users/profile
- DELETE /api/users/account

### EMDR Sessions
- POST /api/sessions - Create new session
- GET /api/sessions - List user sessions
- GET /api/sessions/:id - Get session details
- PUT /api/sessions/:id - Update session
- DELETE /api/sessions/:id - End session

### Agent Interactions
- POST /api/sessions/:id/messages - Send message to agent
- GET /api/sessions/:id/messages - Get session messages
- POST /api/sessions/:id/measurements - Record SUD/VOC measurements

### Safety Monitoring
- POST /api/safety/check - Manual safety check
- GET /api/safety/protocols - Get safety protocols
- POST /api/safety/emergency - Trigger emergency protocols

## Implementation Requirements
1. Express router setup with proper middleware
2. JWT authentication middleware
3. Request validation using Joi or Zod
4. Error handling and response formatting
5. Rate limiting and security headers
6. API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All endpoints documented and tested
- [ ] Authentication middleware protecting routes
- [ ] Proper error handling and status codes
- [ ] Request/response validation
- [ ] Integration tests for all endpoints

üîó **Depends on:** Issue #2 (Backend Services)

## Estimated Effort: 4-5 days
